fields.description:
When an app is deployed to emulator, the deployment intermittently fails with error.

Error type 2
android.util.AndroidException: Can't connect to activity manager; is the system running?
	at com.android.commands.am.Am.run(Am.java:97)
	at com.android.commands.am.Am.main(Am.java:78)
	at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit.finishInit(Native Method)
	at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit.main(RuntimeInit.java:238)
	at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run default app on Android emulator.

Expected Result:

App runs.

Actual Result:

Deployment intermittently fails with error.
fields.summary: Android: Deployment: Android Emulator intermittently fails with error type 2
fields.environment:
SDK: 2.0.0.v20120328183230
Android: V8
Studio: 2.0.0.201203290942
OS: Snow Leopard, Ubuntu 11.10
Devices Tested: Emulator 2.3.3, Emulator 4.0

comments.body: Dustin, does it happen less in 1.0.9? Otherwise, it could be due to many other things, like an upgrade to new versions of Android tooling.
I can give it a few runs, but it is intermittent.
I'm not seeing it in 1.0.9, but there are two related issues (linked).
Closing in favor of the related items.
Closing this ticket as the issue cannot be reproduced.
